intro: Antimima concinna, commonly known as the narrow-leafed antimima, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Antimima concinna is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments.
